description:
High school student Homura Suzuko has returned to Ikebukuro, the town where she grew up. But when she gets to school, she finds she has trouble fitting in with the rest of the class. One day, she decides that if she learns to play the card game Wixoss, she might be able to make some friends. She buys a deck set, and when she opens it, the girl on one of the cards begins to move, and speak.

"Welcome, Selector." Selectors must battle for control of the five coins that hold all their memories. If they can retake all the coins, they win, and can leave the game. But if they lose, as a penalty...

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

__Height:__ 157 cm
__Agency:__ Office Osawa

[Website](http://whv-amusic.com/iguchiyuka/index.html) | [Profile](http://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/iguchiyuka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukachiofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ooo31_iguchiyuka_31ooo/) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/15320.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuka_Iguchi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%95%E5%8F%A3%E8%A3%95%E9%A6%99) | [Youtube](https://youtube.com/@officialyoutubechannel3974?si=9AjlJ6Ujj2Vw1CiU)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Liter - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Otaru Rio - Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu: Cosplay, Hajimemashita (VN)
- 37 - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Koleda Belobog - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
